title: RAG++ NYC | DataStax
description:
Missed DataStax's RAG++ NYC event? Developers and AI enthusiasts got the scoop on the new Unstructured integration, which makes document uploads effortless, an API for seamless integration of your Langflow application with external apps, and a new indexing partnership with Glean. Watch the highlights in this video!

You don't want to miss our next RAG++ event in London on Sept. 24, 2024. Register today! https://www.datastax.com/events/rag-plus-plus-london-sept-2024#register
CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastaxdevs?sub_confirmation=1 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastaxdevs
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/datastaxdevs

ABOUT DATASTAX
➡️DataStax is the company that helps Developers and Companies successfully create a bold new world through GenAI. We offer a One-stop Generative AI Stack with everything needed for a faster, easier, path to production for relevant and responsive GenAI apps. 
➡️DataStax delivers a RAG-first developer experience, with first-class integrations into leading AI ecosystem partners, so we work out with developers’ existing stacks of choice. 
➡️With DataStax, anyone can quickly build smart, high-growth AI applications at unlimited scale, on any cloud. Hundreds of the world’s leading enterprises, including Audi, Bud Financial, Capital One, SkyPoint Cloud, and many more rely on DataStax.

✅ Sign up to try DataStax Astra DB https://dtsx.io/3W4My1H

About DataStax Developer:
On the DataStax Developers YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, workshops and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on Apache Cassandra©.  Visit https://datastax.com/dev for more free learning resources.

transcript.text: one of the things that folks from JP Morgan and Bank of America talked about is one thing is applying the Gen tools versus actually adding value with those tools how can you actually add value with Gen and what kind of actual tools and that brings value to both the bank and the customers so coming to the data stack event and meeting with a lot of Engineers gave me a lot of perspective on the applications that are being ship right now and there's so much growth happening in the industry you know you're looking at Laura versus fine-tuning you're looking at how different variations of rag um fine-tune different models and then agentic Solutions are on the rise my key takeaway from today's sessions are how to improve developer tools from data Stacks themselves and how we can use them as an engineer either in data or in front end or backend it's very interesting how they can integrate many components and then just easy off the shelf drag and drop like functionalities like that my biggest takeaway is hearing the leaders from IBM and Nvidia and glean talk about how they're not trying to get more developers or more money out of the pockets of developers they're just trying to actually make the pool so that there are more developers and more people that can build apps I got a lot of really good insights from the folks from versel from Bank of America data Stacks as well so um you know this was great to hear what they had to say cuz the wealth of information out there what are the right tools and what are the right access points who do you approach to deal with this that's one of the biggest challenges once they get past that hurdle they get to the next stage this session and this conference about land flow and extra database it really give me a lot of exposure How can I convert my research into application
